required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improving HPV Vaccination Rates Among Rural and Native American Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Accelerating Uptake of the HPV Vaccine Among Rural and Native American Adolescents

brief_summary.textblock: This study will develop and implement a multi-level intervention aimed at improving human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccination rates at an Indian rural health clinic.

detailed_description.textblock: The focus of this study is to develop, implement, and evaluate a human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccination program aimed at accelerating vaccine uptake among rural and Native American adolescents ages 11-17. HPV vaccination coverage with at least one dose remains disproportionately lower among rural adolescent compared to adolescents residing in urban areas and the rate of series completion is lower among Native American adolescent girls compared to non-Hispanic White adolescent girls.

primary_outcome.description: HPV vaccine uptake rates (initiation and completion of the 2-dose series) among clinic patients aged 11-17 as measured by the HPV ICD code from baseline to post.

arm_group.description: Participants will be educated on the importance of HPV vaccination.

intervention.description: 1) Training of providers and clinic staff on the importance of providing a strong HPV vaccination program and 2) HPV vaccination education for parents and the community.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinic patients between the ages of 11-17 who are eligible for the HPV vaccine
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

facility.name: University of California, Davis Comprehensive Cancer Center

investigator.last_name: Moon S. Chen Jr., PhD, MPH
